page.title: 16Farm crops
page.content: Soil. Heavy clay. Some places chalky. Low rainfall, therefore largely arable. Crops; wheat, barley, oil seed rape, sugar beet, field beans, potatoes, oats etc. Woodland covers a few acres in patches and there is a small quantity of pastureland for cattle and sheep. Horticultural crops. Several small holdings grow salad and vegetable crops for purchase by local people, also to supply town shops. There is also a garden centre, where plastic or glass greenhouses can be bought, and bedding plants, seeds etc. Of the crops, oil seed rape and sugar beet are the most prolific, but large quantities of barley & wheat are regularly grown.With growing surpluses in the EEC farmers are trying to switch to other crops, suitable for the soil & weather conditions in the area with equal financial returns.
